alert.note: Alert for Washington (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 15 at 7:22AM MDT until March 15 at 5:34PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Boise ID has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Idaho... Weiser River Near Weiser affecting Washington County. For the Weiser River...including Cambridge, Weiser...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO LATE THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Weiser River Near Weiser. * WHEN...From this morning to late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 9.5 feet, Minor flooding of fields and agricultural land near Weiser is possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM MDT Wednesday the stage was 9.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 AM MDT Wednesday was 9.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage this afternoon to 6.1 feet Monday morning. It will then rise to 6.2 feet Monday evening. It will fall to 6.1 feet early Tuesday morning. It will then rise to 7.0 feet Thursday, March 23. It will fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.5 feet on 02/19/1981. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 545 PM MDT.
